description: Don't mind the guys who complain that it is not a free vpn service. Nowhere in the description is said that the service is free, but that it has a free trial. I've been using it for a while (bought lifetime service fo around 40$) and like it very much.

I've had VPN-Unlimited for about 4 years now and have no complaints. It's a solid service whether for torrents or privacy. Lost one star because the Windows client is much more modern looking and feature complete compared to the Linux client.
Barely ever connects, and when it does, barely maintains connection.

The service is inconsistent at best, nonexistent at worst.

When seeking support, it takes days for anyone to get back to you and when they do, they point you to online documentation (which sucks), or send you down a wild goose chase, ultimately to tell you it's your ISP's fault and to talk to them.

Client installs are really, really bad. Resource hogs and unstable. Forget about the Linux client altogether.

Avoid at all costs.
summary: Bad service. Poor support. Botched installs
